<<<<<<< HEAD
A modest plea for private mens preaching. Or An answer to a booke intituled, Private men no pulpit men; composed by Master Giles Workman. Wherein the thing in controversie is briefly debated; the examination of private mens preaching examined; also certain accusations wip'd away and removed. / By John Knowles a preacher of the gospel, formerly in and neer Glocester, now belonging to the life-guard of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax. Knowles, John, fl. 1646-1668.
[4], 36 p.
s.n., London : Printed in the year 1648.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 30th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
